alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 6:35PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Cheyenne and southeastern Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado through 700 PM MDT... At 635 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles south of Stratton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Cheyenne and southeastern Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Firstview. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 410 and 424. Highway 385 between mile markers 162 and 163, and between mile markers 175 and 183. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
